characters: THEN YOU SHOULD HAVE GONE AT
PACK YOUR BAGS AND GET OUT

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -.on JON (20s) leaving work for the day. He looks sweet, diffident. He walks quite enthusiastically down the street.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Singing) Goodbye work It's time to go home Through my town. He’s evidently composing in his head as he goes. Jon turns the corner onto the SEAFRONT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon's P.O.V: CHILDREN play on the sand.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Singing) Children building Castles in the sand In my town. Jon passes a POSTER advertising a gig.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Singing) A band's playing tomorrow night In my town. They're called... Jon looks at the band’s NAME. It is a JUMBLE OF LETTERS.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (Attempting to sing) .--The Soronprfbs A BUS passes. Jon runs after it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon sits on the top deck, looking out. He spots some DRUNK TRAMPS being ignored by passing BUSINESSMEN. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The song mutates into something new.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Singing) Drunk tramps Ignored by businessmen They walk right by you Don't even notice you But you're the special ones The music abruptly stops.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Murmuring) No. Too... shit. EXT. JON’S SUBURBAN STREET - LATER Jon's commute home is almost at an end. He trudges up the hill, passing identical suburban houses. A new song starts. This one sounds rather good.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Singing) I dream of an angel To take me away I dream of an angel To take me away A cautiously excited look crosses Jon's face as he opens his FRONT DOOR. Could this song be the one?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon hurries upstairs.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Singing) I dream of an angel To take... JON'’S MUM (Calling from the kitchen) Hi, sweetheart. How was work?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (As he hurries upstairs) Don’t talk to me. I’ve got an idea for a song. JON'’S MUM Oh mum. Shut your mouth. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: If you talk to me I might forget the song. JON'’S MUM I only asked how work was.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Just let me concentrate on this song I’ve got in my head before I forget it. JON’S MUM Well I’m sure if it’s good it’ll withstand a little small talk with your mother. INT. JON’'S BEDROOM - MOMENTS LATER A typical suburban bedroom. Cool music festival posters on the wall. Jon hurries over to his KEYBOARD, sits down and raises his hands to play. His hands freeze, mid-air. He's forgotten the song.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Murmuring) Shit. He stands, walks over to his computer and pulls up TWITTER.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (As he types) Working on songs. Jon's twitter following is 49.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. OFFICE BUILDING
dialogues.text: There’s no music now - just traffic noise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon sits at his workstation. He seems to be in marketing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon waits for his order. It’s a noisy place - CUSTOMERS ordering, the CLATTER of cutlery. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beneath the noises we can just discern the sound of the radio playing on a shelf - the drone of a local station interview. Something CATCHES JON’S ATTENTION - something coming from the radio? He leans a little closer, trying to hear whatever the sound is - a kind of keening wail? A series of abrupt, violent exclamations? The sound of something smashing? Someone yelling?

dialogues.speaker: CAFE LADY
dialogues.text: (Calling) Cheese and ham panini for Jon?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: On the radio we just catch a distant shout of... WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) ---cunt! Jon stares at the radio, wondering if he could have heard that correctly. The Local DJ sounds a little stunned himself.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL DJ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: That was, that was The... The DJ attempts the same sound Jon made when trying to pronounce the band’s name. And also fails.

dialogues.speaker: LOCAL DJ, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: And ...I can only apologize. Jon looks quizzically at the radio. Then he takes his panini.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon sits on a bench. At the other end of the bench a WOMAN reads GRAZIA magazine. Jon looks at the cover. It’s something about Nicole Scherzinger. Jon pulls out his phone and types into TWITTER.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Nicole Scherzinger hashtag yawn. His number of twitter followers has gone down to 47. He frowns. He becomes aware of some drama occurring on the beach. A PARAMEDIC CREW rushes towards some kind of commotion in the water. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon gets up and - along with other PASSERS-BY - walks over to get a closer look. A MAN is trying to DROWN HIMSELF in the water. Two POLICE OFFICERS attempt to coax him out.

dialogues.speaker: BEARDED MAN
dialogues.text: (Yelling) No! I’m no coming out! Leave me alone! Three figures stand watching from a slight distance, their backs to us. Although we don’t know them yet they are NANA, CLARA and JEAN BARAQUE. Jon finds himself beside a parked VAN. A concerned- looking Californian surfer-type stands next to it. This is DON TEAGUE. The two glance at each other, nod, Jon with a “what happened?” raise of his eyebrows.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: We were at this radio station and, he and Clara had a row or, I don’t know, I guess ...physical fight? Next thing... He indicates the water. Jon's gaze shifts to the VAN. Written on the side of it is the JUMBLE OF LETTERS that comprise the band’s name.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You're The... He gamely tries out the sound.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're playing tonight.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: How? Our keyboard player is trying to drown himself. The EMERGENCY SERVICES wade into the sea. Jon scratches his face. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I play keyboards. Silence. Jon looks worried he sounded opportunistic.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean I'd never... He indicates the tormented man. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Somberly) You're in.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) But I don’t know any of your songs.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Wait there. Don climbs into the mysterious darkness of the van. We hear a murmured conversation. Don reemerges.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you play C, F and G?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Yes?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: You're in. Jon looks a little stunned.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: So what... what do we do now? Don turns back to the beach again, watches with profound sadness as the paramedics load the man onto a stretcher and begin to carry him off the beach. One more fallen comrade.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Should we run through the songs... Or...?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Still watching) Come to the stage door at 9pm.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Great! I’1ll give you my number in case anything... Jon scribbles it down on a piece of paper. Don walks away to the water’s edge. Jon scuttles over and practically prises the paper into Don’s hand.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So. Stage door. 9pm. He throws one last look into the van, wondering who the hell’s in there, and then heads off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon has wound his way up from the beach, just as the paramedics are loading the half-drowned keyboard player into the ambulance. For a moment the two men lock eyes. For an unnerving moment it seems as if THE DROWNED MAN IS TRYING TO TELL JON SOMETHING - as if sensing some link? Then he’s gone. Jon stares at the closing doors of the ambulance.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Is he going to be ok?

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: He'll be fine.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Suddenly worried) He'll still need to spend the night in hospital though, right?

dialogues.speaker: PARAMEDIC
dialogues.text: He swallowed a lot of seawater. He'll have to have his stomach pumped.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Relieved) Plus I suppose there’ll be a whole suicide risk assessment thing. The paramedic looks faintly disgusted at Jon, climbs into the ambulance. Jon watches as it drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon is politely knocking.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Hello? Nothing. Jon looks at his watch. 9pm. Jon knocks harder. The door creaks open. He nervously enters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon walks down the corridor and finds himself in a grimy dressing room. There’s no one there.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Hello? Jon looks around. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On the table there’s a SCRATCHING STICK with a very long, curved arm. There’s also some bottles of beer, one with an EXTREMELY long straw sticking out of it. Jon frowns, perplexed. Suddenly we hear a STRANGE BANGING NOISE from inside the hall. It sounds like someone is repeatedly hitting something. Jon pauses, listens, puzzled. He realizes - this must be the band. He walks towards...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon watches from the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: ON STAGE
dialogues.text: A MIDDLE-AGED WOMAN is repeatedly banging some kind of BIZARRE PERCUSSION INSTRUMENT. This is NANA. A very YOUNG MAN stands playing bass. This is JEAN BARAQUE. A furious looking woman stands provocatively at the front of the stage, eating a pear. She tosses it aside and stalks over to an odd, vast contraption covered in knobs and dials and a MAD JUMBLE of coloured wires - an early-1970s analog synthesizer. This is CLARA. She eats the pear, tosses it aside and raises her hands over the dials. She begins to play. Together they’re making an EXTREMELY EXPERIMENTAL collection of sounds. The audience watch this odd trio uncertainly, waiting for something to happen. And out of the darkness of the wings someone Jon hadn’t noticed emerges... He’s doing a weird jerking, shuffling dance to the music. Strangest of all - he’s wearing a large FAKE HEAD, with a SMILING FACE painted onto it. This is FRANK. Jon and the audience gawp at the strange apparition dancing across the stage before disappearing into the shadows of the opposite wings. Then he wheels around and dances back on. Jon becomes aware that Don is standing next to him in the wings. They look at each other for a moment. Then Don gently pushes Jon onto the stage. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Nana and Baraque ignore him, playing relentlessly on. Clara glares at him but doesn’t move. Jon stands there, not sure what to do next. Then he notices a BATTERED OLD KEYBOARD set up near the back. He walks over, stares down at it. CLOSE ON JON’S FACE - a faint frown, thinking stopped. Almost by itself, his hand reaches out and he begins to play - just a little three note figure. And it fits. As the song begins to swell, Jon’s other hand joins the first and he begins to play along. Then Frank lifts the mic he’s holding and begins to sing - and it’s one of the strangest sounds you could imagine. Beautiful and ridiculous at the same time. Jon is lost in the ecstacy of the moment - the realization of a dream. Then it is abruptly over. The audience are staring in silence, unsure what just happened - not that any of the band are paying them any attention anyway. Clara has noticed FLAMES licking out the back of her synthesiser. More irritated than alarmed, she uses an old scorched towel to beat out the flames, burning her hand in the process. Across the stage, Baraque has already begun the bass line to the next song.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: What are you doing? Baraque continues playing.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Stop. Will you... Clara throws a can of WD40 at him. It hits his face.

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (In French, subtitled) Now I will have a bruise.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Good. Something to look at on your otherwise nothing face. Baraque indicates the AUDIENCE.

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (In French, subtitled) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Now they see what you’re like. So joyless. So angry. Baraque storms off stage. Clara kicks her synthesiser to the floor where it lies, fizzing and sparking faintly, and stalks off through the opposite wings. Nana gives a resigned sigh, picks up her sticks and leaves the stage as well. For a moment it’s JUST JON AND FRANK, standing in front of the nonplussed audience. Jon looks uncertainly at the strange singer and Frank turns his great head to look at Jon - as if seeing him for the first time. Then Clara is marching back on-stage. She takes Frank by the hand and leads him away. Leaving Jon alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band are finishing loading equipment into the van, in a cold, angry silence. There is no sign of Frank. He must already be in the van. No-one pays any attention to Jon, who stands watching as they all climb in and drive off without him. INT. JON’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Jon lies in bed, tweeting on his phone.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Typing) . Played keyboards with The... Jon has forgotten the name of the band.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .-.-with a band tonight. Enjoyed working with them a lot. INT. JON’S LIVING ROOM - MORNING Jon is miserably watching BREAKFAST TV. The keyboard catches his eye. He walks over and starts to play. He tries to remember the weird, wonderful melody from the night before. He gets a few notes right but then loses his way, the whole thing fading already, like a dream... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He stumbles on for a little longer but then gives up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A miserable Jon walks to work. He doesn’t compose a song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon looks bored. Has gazes out of the window. He doesn’t compose a song. His phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: DON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It’s me. So Lucas got out of the hospital and begged Clara to let him back in the band but she told him to lick her ass.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: DON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So we need a keyboard player. And Frank said “Remember that grateful looking boy who jumped up onto the stage last week uninvited.”

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) I wasn’t uninvited. You invited me.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Frank said he thought you brought something cherishable that night. He can sound pretty muffled under the head and so the rest of us thought he said you brought something perishable. Like food that decays easily. Fish or fruit. So we all said, “Come on, man, anyone can do THAT.” But then he repeated it clearer and we all agreed to let you join. So. Are you in?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Good. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He hangs up. Jon looks shell-shocked. The phone rings again. Jon answers.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I forgot to tell you where to meet us.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Relieved) I know.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Clacket Lane Services on the M25 at 5pm today. Bring a passport.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon is waiting at Clacket Lane. He stares at a wall of fog and drizzle. Nothing. Will this be another disappointment? But then two headlights appear, glowing faintly in the gloom and out of the fog drives the band’s battered TOUR BUS, come to save us. Jon watches with a mixture of excitement and nervousness as the tour bus drives towards him. He pulls out his phone. CLOSE on the phone: Twitter.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (As he types) You would not believe what’s happening to me right now. The van pulls up and the door slides open. We can’t see inside.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Burbling) Hi. Hello. I wasn’t sure where to wait. Clacket Lane’s pretty labyrinthine, isn’t it? No answer issues from the van. After a moment Jon climbs in. The doors close and the van sets off once more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon sits in the front beside DON, who compared to the rest of the band looks reassuringly normal. Behind Jon sit Nana, Baraque and Clara in all their compelling, alarming, silent, intense other- worldliness. And in the back, still wearing his FAKE HEAD, is Frank. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (Suddenly, in French - subtitled) I need to go to the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Furious )

dialogues.speaker: CLACKET LANE
dialogues.text: Silence resumes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The bus hurtles through the gloom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A foggy evening. There’s hardly anyone around. The bus is loading onto a Ferry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through the fog we see the band showing their passports to two OFFICERS. They reach Frank. They stare at his head.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I have a certificate. His accent is American. The officers lead him inside the hut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The ferry is crossing the North Sea. Don stands on deck at the rails, smoking. Jon stands beside him.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Can I ask... where are we going Don?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: We’re going to Sweden, Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Okay. A pause. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: What do you think of Frank?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Um... Jon and Don glance over at Frank. He’s sitting on a bench on deck. Clara is, as always, at his side. Frank is smoking a cigarette, using a long cigarette holder that curls under the head’s neckline. He finishes his cigarette, pulls it out of the holder, and tosses the butt away. It catches in the North Sea wind and flies back into his head. Frank and Clara frantically pat down his ‘face’ to stop a fire from breaking out.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: He's fucking amazing isn’t he? He lives all the way out there, man. Don indicates the infinite, black sea, stretching out beyond them.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: In the furthest corners. I wanna be him.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat. Carefully) Don? Can I ask... the head...?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: He never takes it off. Jon thinks about this, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Never?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: He sleeps in it?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What about eating?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: He sucks liquid food through a straw that he funnels up under the neckline. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What kind of liquid food?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Complan.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: He must have a very bushy beard.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Not necessarily.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: How does he clean his teeth? Don sighs.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: You're just going to have to go with this, Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I’m sorry. I’m just... it’s pretty crazy, isn’t it? He laughs nervously.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Smiling) I understand. But let me tell you something. Frank, for all his ‘issues’, is without a doubt the most one hundred percent sanest cat I ever met.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Believe it. (Beat) Me, on the other hand... He laughs. Jon joins in.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Oh, well... you seem pretty sane to me! Don nods, stares out at the sea, smiling.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Yeah. (Beat) But no, seriously, I am severely mentally ill. I spent a lot of time ina psychiatric hospital. Jon's smile fades. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Sadly) I used to have sexual relations with mannequins.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Right.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Informatively) It’s a condition.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. VAN
dialogues.text: The van drives through a snowy landscape, away from the ferry port, the sun rising on the horizon. Jon is in the back, next to Frank, who appears to be snoozing. Clara and Nana and Baraque are all asleep in the front. Jon nervously glances over at Frank’s head. He scrutinizes the hair, the painted cheek... As he looks closer he suddenly notices an EYEBALL staring out at him through the EAR HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Shrieking) Jesus Christ! The eye vanishes, retreating back into the darkness of the head. Jon faces front again. The others still sleep. After a moment Jon hears a noise from under Frank’s head.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Tsss. Frank is indicating that Jon gets closer. Jon does. Frank indicates closer still.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Tsss. Jon awkwardly gets his ear very close to Frank's ‘mouth’.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (An urgent whisper) HELP ME. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon recoils. Clara stirs in the front, turns to look at them. Frank hurriedly pretends to be asleep. We hear fake snores from inside the head. Jon stares ahead, not knowing what the hell just happened.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (driving) We'll be there in two hours people.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: At the venue?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: At the... where we’re playing tonight?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: We’re not playing tonight Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Oh. (Beat) I’ve only brought an overnight bag. No-one answers.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t suppose... if we're staying more than one night, maybe if see anywhere that sells clothes and...

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Oh. The keyboard player wants to stop. Jon says nothing, but notes the insult.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. SWEDISH MOTORWAY SERVICES
dialogues.text: Jon looks at the T-shirts. They’ve all got Swedish tourist slogans: I Love Swedish Girls, I Feel Sweden and one with a bright yellow silhouette of a naked girl hitch hiker, with SWEDEN emblazoned on the top. Needs must, Jon picks the naked girl hitch-hiker. He walks towards the CHECKOUT. Frank is suddenly beside him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Take my arm. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What? Frank links Jon’s arm, and starts to lead him towards the door.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Two friends going for a walk. Who could question THAT? They exit the shop.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Hissing, urgently) I am being held against my will. By the woman. Jon looks perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: GET ME OUT OF HERE
dialogues.text: Jon hesitates for a second.

dialogues.speaker: RUN
dialogues.text: WIDE: Jon and Frank run urgently across the car park, towards a FOREST.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s snowing. Frank and Jon hack through the undergrowth together. Jon keeps turning to see if they’re being followed. They aren't.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Energized) I never felt better in my life. Thank you! It’s been terrible. Frank breathes in the air, a FREE MAN at last.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: How long has the woman...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Clara.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: How long has Clara held you for? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don’t even know! Jon leans over and brushes a dusting of snow from the top of Frank’s head. Franks seems to flinch slightly.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (By way of explanation) Snow.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Thank you! (Surveying the forest) God! Wow! You saved my life. I'll never forget this. Jon and Frank continue to walk for a while.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Kindly) Is she the one who makes you constantly wear... Frank suddenly stops. His ‘face’ stares at Jon eerily. Jon indicates the head.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The... big false head? Frank continues to stare. Jon looks suddenly worried that Frank may not even know that he’s wearing a false head.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Panicking a bit) Okay. Too many questions. What we need to do is work out the practicalities. They resume hacking through the undergrowth.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Our bags are on the bus. So we don’t have any... thing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Picking up on Jon's panic) What’1l happen at nightfall? My face stays warm but the rest of me can get very cold. Frank's head gets wedged between two branches. He struggles and fails to get free.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh God. Oh God. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: It's okay. I’ve got it. Jon prises Frank's head free.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Thank you. Ahead of them is a fairly bare MOTORWAY SERVICES AREA. Jon pats his pockets.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Money. I haven’t got any money. Have you got money?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m sorry?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Urgently) Money! Have you got any money? There is a pause. Frank hands Jon his change.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Sounding nervous) It’s all I have.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: It’s not much. Have you got a cashpoint card? Frank nervously shakes his head no. They emerge from the woods and enter the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s just a toilet and a coffee/snack stand on a lay- by. There are a few other people there - TRUCKERS, a FAMILY.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (With nervous over- politeness) Would you mind if I go to the toilet?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Distracted) Mmm? No, that’s fine. Frank immediately scurries frantically away across the tarmac. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (In a flap, not noticing Frank has gone) Okay. I’1l send out an S.O.S tweet. Jon gets out his phone and types urgently into Twitter:

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The singer from The... (Beat) -band I've joined is a kidnap victim. I rescued him and we're now on the run.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Behind Jon's back, Frank zigzags around, panicked and confused, until he’s FAR AWAY ACROSS THE TARMAC. The Family and Truckers eye the scene with uncertainty.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Still typing) Does anyone know the number for the Swedish police? Frank runs up to a TRUCKER.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: That man kidnapped me!

dialogues.speaker: TRUCKER
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: He’s taken all my money! I’ve managed to get away from him. Frank scuttles into the forest, where he vanishes. The TRUCKER and his CO-TRUCKER start running towards Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Oblivious, still typing) If anything happens to us I want it on record that the kidnapper is called Clara. Jon turns around just in time to see the two truckers loom over him.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: TRUCKER
dialogues.text: (In broken English) The man in the head has said some things about you. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What? The trucker takes Jon's arm.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Hey. Let go of me. Jon angrily pulls his arm free. At this, the second trucker throws himself on Jon. The phone flies out of his hand, smashing on the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The SWEDISH POLICE are releasing Jon back to the band. Don is emerging from the woods leading a dishevelled Frank, his clothes matted with leaves and mud. Clara gives Jon a withering look. Jon looks embarrassed and confused. Don wanders over to Jon.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Don’t worry about it. Everyone kidnaps Frank sooner or later.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. TOUR VAN
dialogues.text: The van passes through the lovely snowy landscape. Jon glances at his iPhone. He’s managed to stick it together with gaffer tape so it’s cracked but still working. His Twitter following has shot up to 946.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Wow.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Here it is! Vetno! Our new home.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I LIKE it! The band look out of the van windows. Stunned. EXT. “VETNO” — SWEDEN - MOMENTS LATER A beautiful, enormous, weird wooden house stands in snowy grounds - something from a fairy tale. The band stare at it. Jon looks confused and alarmed. Don unlocks the huge, wooden front door. They enter. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Clutching his overnight bag) Excuse me. How long will we be staying here for? Nobody answers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band walk through the amazing house, taking it all in. Jon walks alongside them, wide-eyed, but ANXIOUS, examining the others as much as his surroundings.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (To Don) Don. Sorry. I told work I'd be back on Monday. So do you think... A small shriek O.S. Frank has got his head wedged in the gap between the staircase and the wall. Don frees him.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (To Frank) Problem area. Under staircase.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Cheerfully) Noted. They climb the stairs and reach the upstairs landing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..of Don showing each band member their BEDROOMS. They’re all SPACIOUS and BEAUTIFUL. Jon’s is last, at the end of the corridor.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: And here’s your room, Jon. It is TINY - the SMALLEST in the house. But it is still a strange and interesting little wooden room, like something from a fairy tale. INT. JON’S BEDROOM - VETNO - CONTINUOUS

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Don. How long are we going to be here?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Just as long as it takes to make the album, Jon. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Don closes the door, leaving Jon alone in the bedroom. He stands there - his bag in his hand. INT. VETNO - JON’S BEDROOM - DAY Jon looks out of the window. We hear a Theremin playing - beautiful, ghostly.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Vetno. Jon sits on his bed. He types a BLOG.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sweden. Jon thinks. Types carefully...

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Snowing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara is playing a Theremin in the snow, a power cable running back into the house. She looks lost in the music quite lovely.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: We've been here a week. It's a whole new way of living - quite unlike anything I've ever known. Jon takes a step towards her.

dialogues.speaker: THEREMIN.
dialogues.text: Jon takes an anxious step backwards.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon looks into a bedroom to see Clara, Nana and Baraque lying in bed together, draped casually over one another, Baraque reading a book.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: All the usual bourgeoise rules have been thrown out of the window. Jon covertly peeks at Clara’s cleavage. He regards the Bohemian lifestyle with admiration.  25.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nana queues for the bathroom. Jon exits, a towel draped over him in a manner so ‘studied bohemian’ he’s making no attempt to cover his penis. A horrified Nana puts her hands over her eyes and shrinks away, VERY UPSET.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Although one still has to be aware of the limits.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Don is telling Jon off. Nana still looks upset. At the end of the corridor, regarding the scene, is Frank.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And at the heart of the beautiful madness is Frank. Frank. How to describe Frank? INT. VETNO - JON’S BEDROOM - EARLIER Jon is unpacking his overnight bag. He looks up to see Frank standing in the doorway, watching him, his big painted smile, his hands on his hips. Jon smiles at him

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Sometimes he seems friendly. Frank slips into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But at other times more ..-menacing... Frank reappears in the doorway. Something in his body language makes him seem more threatening this time. Maybe it’s because he no longer has his hands on his hips. They’re hanging limply at his side. Jon looks at him nervously, then instinctively lowers his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: But then ...friendly again. Jon looks up again to find that Frank has his hands on his hips again.  26.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is watching a stupid Swedish comedy programme, shaking with laughter. Jon watches from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Also quite ...childish?

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Frank is still shaking with laughter - although it’s now harder to see why, as he’s watching a gardening programme.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Disconcerting. But mostly...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is ADDRESSING the band at dinner.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Clara. Don. Nana. Baraque... Frank looks at Jon.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Coughing) Mhwr.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Politely) Jon. Frank stretches out his arms.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (With enthusiasm) Jon. Here, in Vetno, on our own land, we will make music that has never been made before. We will journey to the furthest corners and grab hold of the music we find there. We are, every one of us, amazing. Here in Vetno we will become even more amazing. And we will capture it, here in Vetno, on our first ever album.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: «+. mostly inspiring.  27. INT. VETNO - JON’S BEDROOM - NIGHT Jon is finishing writing his blog. Moonlight pours in through the window.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: So settling into communal living isn't easy. New people, new rules. But it's worth it because of Frank. I'm happy to be part of this. Just... happy. Jon presses send. He closes his laptop. A beat of silence. Then from outside comes a sudden CRY. Silence. Then another muffled shout of distress. Jon looks out the window.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon comes out the back door of the house wearing his coat and boots but no trousers. He sees Don, NAKED, running towards the tree-line at the bottom of the grounds and the frozen river beyond. In the distance, near the river, Clara plays her outdoor Theremin.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Shrieking - in the doorway ) Don! Get back here! (To Jon) Don’t let him get to the river! Jon runs after him, chasing Don as he zig-zags across the snow, but he’s too slow to catch him. Don shakes him off. Don is almost at the river when Clara stoops from behind her Theremin, picks up a lump of WOOD and hurls it at him. It catches Don on the side of the head and he spins to the ground, rolling over and over in the snow.

dialogues.speaker: ON DON
dialogues.text: -.as he lies crying. Frank approaches.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Let me do it Frank! I don’t want to be me. Nana and Baraque are standing a little way off, looking scared. (CONTINUED)
Frank gives Don a sad hug, although the size of Frank’s ‘head’ makes hugging quite an awkward experience for the person being hugged, so Don has to crane his neck right back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits alone on the sofa. Jon watches him from the other side of the room.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Sadly) Did he tell you about the mannequins?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I met one once. Caroline Cuntley. He offers Jon a handshake, as if he has no memory of ever meeting him before.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m Frank.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) I’m Jon. They shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Beat) Does he still ...with the mannequins?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No, he has relationships with real women now. But ...it’s hard you know? He has to try and convince them to lie completely still, so... (He shrugs) Don’t tell Don I said anything. He might think it’s a shameful secret or something. But I say Tell Everyone Everything! Why cover anything up? Beat. Jon glances at the fake head encasing a real head.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Sure. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Frank leans forward, his ‘head’ in his hands.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Indicating the head) Why do you...?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You think it’s weird?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: A bit.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Well normal faces are weird too. The way they’re smooth... Frank mimes with his hands the curvature of Jon's cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: +..smooth...smooth...and then... Frank mimes with his hands Jon's eyes, nose and mouth - a mime of utter chaos.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-bleurewwweurgh... There’s something lovely but slightly unnerving about Frank's way of speaking. The words tumble out of him, like he’s a passenger in his own thought process.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All bumpy and holes and I mean what are EYES like? Like a science-fiction movie. And don’t get me started on lips. They’re like the edges of a very serious wound.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Thoughtfully) That’s true. But your head is still sort of ...intimidating.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Underneath I’m giving you a welcoming smile.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Are you?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Like this! The same static expression. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Would it help if I said my facial expressions out loud?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Okay. I’ve been wanting to thank...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Welcoming smile.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: ...to thank you. Ever since that night I played with the...sorry, what’s the name of the band again?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I have NO IDEA.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Why do you have an impossible to say, spell or remember band name?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It was Clara's idea.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Anyway, ever since I played with you that night I haven’t been able to think about anything else.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: It was the best concert we ever did. Jon doesn’t know how to respond to this. Clara enters.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (To Frank) He’s asleep. I'm going to bed. So if you want help getting to bed you should come now... Unless you want to keep going with your little chat with the keyboard player.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Coughs ) I’m not just a keyboard player. I write songs too.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Oh? How many ‘songs’ have you written?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: About 40. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A dreadful silence from Clara.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Enthusiastically) You write your own songs?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I'd love to play some for you sometime.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I'd really like that! Big non- threatening smile indicating that there’s no such thing as failure in Vetno! Jon points at his own delighted face.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Delighted look!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You’re FUNNY! Frank points at his own face.

dialogues.speaker: DELIGHTED LOOK
dialogues.text: Frank and Jon laugh. Clara looks disgusted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon passes a bedroom. He peers in. JON'S P.O.V - Clara lies asleep in bed. Frank sits on a chair next to the bed. Jon stands in the doorway. Frank sees him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Whispering) First rehearsal tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Whispering) I’ve already got an idea for a new song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band has gathered in the rehearsal room. They’re IMPROVISING far out, experimental music. Jon is surprised to find himself keeping up with it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Calling over to Jon) Hey. How did that song you were working on last night turn out?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I think kind of interesting.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Why don’t you play it for us?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Sure. It’s pretty rudimentary. Feel free to join in if you like. It’s called Messy Rainbow. Jon starts to play his composition. Which sounds quite deep and intense and uncannily like Paranoid Android by Radiohead.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Singing) My mind's a Messy Rainbow And suicide's The only way To make the messy feelings go Away. A fragile looking DON listens, unnoticed, from the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Singing relentlessly) Let me do it. Let me drown myself Don't wanna be me. Don looks upset by the song. So do the band. Jon doesn’t notice. He’s lost in his music, playing relentlessly on.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Singing) Let me drown...

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Interrupting)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Everyone turns around, thrilled to see him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Hey buddy! They surround Don, ignoring Jon.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How you feeling? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Better. Jon awkwardly stops playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A lovely spring day. The band are walking amid the nature.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Frank has decided to delay rehearsals while everyone has a chance to get back on their feet. In the meantime we're doing what he calls ‘Fieldwork’.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ..of the band amid the nature. They’re COLLECTING NATURAL SOUNDS on tape recorders.

dialogues.speaker: IN A FIELD
dialogues.text: Nana records the sound of a butterfly flapping it’s wings.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE BEACH
dialogues.text: Baraque records the waves hitting the rocks. Clara records the wind whipping through a cave. A TERN ominously circles them all. They all stare up at it. It swoops down, squawking, and dive-bombs Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Shrieking) For fuck’s sake! It could have attacked any one of us! Why choose me? The bird files away.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Like the zoo scene in The Omen, really. Frank points his tape recorder at Jon.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What was the sound the seabird made as it swooped down, Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Kind of... Jon lets out a BLOODCURDLING SQUAWK. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They all laugh. Jon laughs too.

dialogues.speaker: EVENING
dialogues.text: The fieldwork is over and they walk back towards Vetno, thoroughly happy. Even Jon seems finally to have settled in with the others.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To Frank) That was a lovely April day. Frank hesitates for a moment. Then he continues walking.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Frank is at the piano, composing a song called APRIL DAY. It is by far the loveliest and most accessible song we've heard from him. Jon listens, entranced. The other band members do their own thing in other parts of the room. Jon gets out his mobile phone and COVERTLY FILMS Frank singing April Day. Frank finishes the song.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Stunned) Frank. That was beautiful.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Flattered grin followed by a bashful half-smile.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I had no idea you could write music so ...lovely. That song could be big. Clara laughs sarcastically from across the room.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Yes! Top of the Pops for us! I’1ll phone Lady Gaga! Baraque sniggers.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Calling) Maybe we can play Superbowl Sunday! I’1l get T-shirts made! More sniggering from Baraque. Frank pulls Jon to one side. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Whispering) You understand!

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Understand what? Clara glances over suspiciously at their private conversation.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Understand that people could like our music. Clara doesn’t want people to like us.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I don’t know. It’s weird.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Glancing over at Clara) It’s really weird.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. VETNO
dialogues.text: Jon is busy making a stew. Clara enters.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: What's this?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Indicating the stew) And what’s THIS?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Stew.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: You're making us brain dead with your vegetables you dreary old woman.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Mystified) It’s just a stew, Clara. It’s hearty.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Someone needs to punch you in the face. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Perry Como eats stew while he sits in his ROCKING CHAIR

dialogues.speaker: LOOKING AT HIS CHRISTMAS
dialogues.text: DECORATIONS. Is that the music you want us to make? Jon blinks.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: No. Clara steps in close.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Why are you here? Clara glances in disgust at Jon's SWEDISH TOURIST t- shirt.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You're not going to meet any naked hitch-hikers here. So why don’t you stop having secret conversations with Frank and go home. Jon gathers his courage.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Fuck you. Clara steps in close.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Frank picked me. Okay? So it’s not up to you.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: He... he said I was cherishable. And he picked me to join the band.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (A smile spreading across her face) He picked you? There wasn’t anyone else. Don couldn’t find anyone else. So we were STUCK with you. You're just some fingers being told which keys to press. Ten little bits of bone and skin. Jon tries to laugh derisively but looks worried that it may be true. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I... I press my own keys, ok? And, anyway, I’m perfectly capable of finding a way of going to my furthest corners and...composing music...

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Your furthest WHAT?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) My furthest corners. Clara smiles coldly.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: You know that incredibly insensitive song about Don’s suicide attempt you sang us all the other day?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Yes?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: It was basically Paranoid Android by Radiohead.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) No it wasn’t.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Sings) “From a great height. From a great height...” You sang (Sings) “Let me do it. Let me drown myself.” Exactly the same.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) No it’s not.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: You want to know where your furthest corners are? Clara walks right up to Jon and waves her hand an inch in front of his face.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right there! And you know where mine and Frank’s furthest corners are? Clara opens the back door and runs out into the snow. She keeps running until she’s far, far away. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Yelling) ..-here! Jon stands at the back door, staring out at her, furious.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You’re wrong!

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Yelling) Lick my ass!

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Yelling) You’ve only made me more determined than ever to go to my furthest corners and make something of myself in this band and help Frank reach his potential too!

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Yelling) Lick my ass!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on Frank. He’s making an announcement.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Lips pursed together as if to say, “enough frivolity”. Today we begin work in earnest on the album. WIDE - the band sit watching Frank. MONTAGE begins.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Frank wants us to start everything from scratch. Frank writes out a strange symbols on a white board for the band to see.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He's created an entirely new musical notation system... Jon covertly films the scene on his mobile phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara and Baraque are making a strange contraption involving household implements. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: ...and new musical instruments...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band are watching a presentation. A wire runs from Frank's head to a dial in Don’s hand. As we watch Don turns the dial and Frank's head begins to GLOW EERILY - lit by some inner mechanism.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He's working on some new forms of visual entertainment... Don turns the dial to high - the head glows brightly, then there is flash of light and smoke begins to pour from Frank’s eye and ear holes. Don and the others throw wet blankets onto Frank to put the fire out. Jon covertly films it all on his mobile phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band queue outside the room for their daily Gestalt Therapy Session.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: .-.and he wants us to deconstruct everything about our lives. We can hear Clara inside yelling at Nana.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Yelling) You fat old whore! You useless bitch! Why are you so fucking ugly? Dragging around like a broken sow pig! The door opens and Nana walks out, smoking and unruffled. Clara waves in her next victim, looking like a dentist. A nervous-looking Jon enters the bedroom. Clara gives a small smile of anticipation as she closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank is on the floor in the middle of a wrestling bout with Baraque. He’s surprisingly strong.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: He's initiated a strict regime of physical exercise. In a few moments Frank has Baraque pinned and is bending his arm. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Fortunately we have a “safeword” for when things get too intense.

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (The “safeword” ) Chinchilla! Frank releases him and the two get up and shake hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band jog around the house.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Someone’s thinking in the key of c!

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Calling, as she runs) Frank can feel someone thinking in the key of C!

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (As he runs) Il n'est pas moi.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (As he runs) It’s me. Clara runs over to Jon and UNEXPECTEDLY PUNCHES HIM IN THE FACE.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Sometimes tensions run pretty high. The other band members pull her off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank, Nana and Baraque are gathered around the back door, listening intently as it RATTLES in the wind. From somewhere outside comes an answering CREAK of metal from another door.

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (Puzzled) Je ne peux pas... Frank holds up a hand to silence him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Can you hear it? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Nana and Baraque listen anxiously, trying to hear what Frank is hearing.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Nana and Baraque are playing bass and snare drum by the door, mimicking the odd little rhythm of the rattle and creak. Frank listens, bouncing his head along enthusiastically.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We could make an entire album out of this one sound! Nana and Baraque smile. Jon covertly films on his mobile phone.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Frank finds inspiration in everything. I'd love to get inside that head. Inside that head. I/E. JON’S BEDROOM - AFTERNOON Jon sits working on a new song. It sounds LOVELY. Jon looks very happy with it as he plays.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I'm really developing as a songwriter and hope maybe to even have some of my own songs on the album. Jon continues to play as he glances out of the window. JON'’s P.O.V - OUT OF THE WINDOW. Frank is lying on a mat in the snow, sunbathing in swimming trunks, still wearing the head, of course. Clara is standing over him.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Looking up) How long?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Looking at her watch) One more hour. Frank resumes sunbathing. CLOSE on Clara.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Which may not go down so well with some other members of the band. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Don enters Jon’s bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (As he plays) Hey. I’m composing a song. Don listens for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Commiserating) Oh, man. I know.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Sighing in commiseration) I know how it feels to try and write a song and it just comes out shit. Jon's hands freeze at the keyboard. Don sits down next to him.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Sadly) Listen to this. Don plays something unexpectedly lovely and quite brilliantly professional.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (As he plays) I composed this. Yeah, I know. It’s shit. Sooner or later you get the feeling, “Why can’t I be like Frank? Maybe I can be him?” But there can only be one Frank, man.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Stiffly) Actually, I think both our songs sound pretty good.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Sharing the joke) Ha! Right! Don lights a joint.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m not supposed to because of my psychosis but fuck it, right? He pulls on the joint. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon’s eyes Don nods. Done shake: 43. (2)

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Frank, man. You can’t get there. I’ve tried, but he’s too far out. I've known it since the moment I first saw him.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What was he doing when you first saw him?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: A doctor was trying to wrestle his head off. So he was totally freaking out.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You first met him at a place with doctors? widen.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: A mental hospital? He offers Jon the joint. Jon refuses.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How did he end up there?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Shrugging) He doesn’t talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Have you ever seen him without the head? s his head.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe he’s facially disfigured!

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Pulling on the joint) Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Forced to wear a mask. Like The Elephant Man.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Oh man! (Beat) He told me once he came from Louisiana. That’s all I know.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Louisiana? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Quatchita, Louisiana. Jon stares sullenly at the keyboard.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: It’s all right for Frank. He’s mentally ill.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Beat) You ever tried Ayahuasca?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Ayahuasca. Shamen have been using it for thousands of years. You really want to try and go where Frank is, you should try it. It’s a hallucinogenic so deep-acting it awakens your dormant plant DNA.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I don’t think we have dormant plant DNA. Don looks at Jon like he’s crazy.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Well I sure as hell do.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Jon lies on the bed, warily looking at his keyboard. He falls asleep.

dialogues.speaker: THE NEXT MORNING
dialogues.text: Jon sits at his LAPTOP. ON THE SCREEN - An empty Google search box. Jon’s finger drifts over the keyboard. He presses H...O...

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: The GOOGLE AUTOFILL FUNCTION kicks in. All the search terms beginning with the letter H and O that Jon has ever typed appear in a scroll-down list: Horny Brunette masturbates and flashes her asshole Hot Asian teen takes two cocks Hot young college girls strip down and take dick Jon keeps typing: How to be creative.  45.

dialogues.speaker: MOMENTS LATER
dialogues.text: Jon watches a VIDEO called Unlocking Your Creativity.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGEMENT GURU
dialogues.text: Creative people like you can see solutions where other less creative people don’t even realize there’s a problem! Take everyday activities like shaving.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see various accoutrements necessary for Frank's condition - four normal-sized toothbrushes and one with a custom-built ESPECIALLY LONG ARM, an equally long RAZOR and bottles of SPRAY FACE CREAM with long necks. Jon is rubbing shaving foam onto his face.

dialogues.speaker: MANAGEMENT GURU, (0O.S.)
dialogues.text: As Edward De Bono once said, how often does someone who is using a traditional wet razor stop to consider whether instead of moving the razor it might be easier to keep the razor still and move the face? Jon begins to shave in this radical, creative new way - keeping the razor still whilst moving his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara stands waiting for the bathroom. From inside we suddenly hear Jon give an UNUSUAL CRY of pain. Clara listens, INTRIGUED.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Oh... God!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band stand around as Clara plays a THEREMIN SOLO that’s obviously been inspired by the UNUSUAL SHRIEK Jon let out. The band nod, impressed.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: I call it The Idiot Shriek.

dialogues.speaker: JEAN BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (Murmuring) C'est tres belle. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon watches bitterly, his face tufted with tissue to staunch the blood from his deep shaving cuts. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: BANG
dialogues.text: The band look ASTONISHED. They glance anxiously at each other. Hopefully it was just their imagination.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Quietly) There’s someone at the door. Nobody moves.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Nervously) I‘’ll go. We stay with the band as they watch Don walk towards the front door. He opens it. There are four LARGE YOUNG MEN standing there. They are muscular and heavily-tattooed. They and Don speak for a moment. The band watch with concern, unable to hear the conversation. Don leaves them standing there and walks back towards the others.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Trying to control his emotions) Okay, I have some news. We have to leave this house. The band stare at him in puzzled silence.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Freaking out)

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Don has been calmed with a cup of cocoa. The four new men are standing together at the back of the room.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Okay. Start again, Don. Patient Smile.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Will you stop saying your fucking facial expressions out loud? It’s incredibly annoying. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Beat) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: We've run out of time. We’ve spent all our rent money. They gave us 30 days notice to leave. And we didn’t leave. So they’ve rented Vetno to a new band. They look at the four new men, who smile awkwardly.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: (In broken English) We're Bloodbath.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (To Don) How long have you known this was going to happen?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Beat) 30 days.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Why didn’t you tell us?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Beat) I didn’t want to disappoint you.

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (In French -— subtitled) We haven’t recorded one note of the album. Everyone looks at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I can pay. Everyone looks at Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: When my father died I inherited money. He said it was my nest egg. He said I should only ever spend my nest egg on something really, really important. (His voice breaking) I want you to have my nest egg. Frank stands up. He HUGS Jon. As always with Frank’s hugs, the size of the head makes it quite awkward. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: It’ll buy us enough time to make the album.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: (Broken English) We've driven all the way from Hudiksvall.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I’1l give you money to leave.

dialogues.speaker: LARGE YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) 5000 Krona. The men look satisfied.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (To Jon) Thank you so, so much. Jon can’t resist shooting Clara a little grin of triumph. FADE OUT.

dialogues.speaker: FADE IN
dialogues.text: INT. JON’S BEDROOM - VETNO - NIGHT CLOSE on Jon’s hands as he writes his blog.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It's been a while since I've written anything. We've been pretty busy, working on the new music, fourteen hours a day, for... We pan up Jon's body. He’s still wearing his naked hitch- hiker t-shirt, now massively faded. We see his face. He has long hair and a full beard.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (Calculating) ---a@ year and eleven months now. Which has depleted my nest egg a lot more than I anticipated.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking through the lighted windows to the band practising the same complicated five second sequence... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Again! Again...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Again!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band, wild-eyed and feral, the men long-haired and bearded, ravenously eat their tiny daily ration of SOYA BEANS.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It hasn't been easy. None of us have left Vetno since we got here. We've had to start rationing the food.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. FRONT DOOR
dialogues.text: A GROCERY BOY stands at the door. Jon, looking starving and animalistic, opens it. The boy - overpowered by a waft of Fetid Commune Smell - quickly hands Jon the grocery bag. Jon immediately rifles ravenously through it until he finds a jar of HOT CHOCOLATE POWDER. He guiltily scurries to a corner and pours it hungrily into his mouth. Clara, passing-by, spots Jon.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Thief! She runs over and attempts to pull the powder from Jon's grasp, whilst simultaneously prising open his mouth and thrusting in her hand, scraping the powder from inside it.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I want it ALL back! Clara pulls Jon's fingers painfully back.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Yelling) Those are my KEYBOARD PLAYING

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: Clara's hatred of me remains as strong and baffling as ever. I just seem to rub her up the wrong way. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In their struggle the hot chocolate jar explodes, the powder covering them in a cloud. Frank walks in. Clara and Jon stand, caught out, both covered in chocolate. Frank stares at them in silence for a moment. INT. JON’S BEDROOM - VETNO - DAY Jon composes at his keyboard. The song is just flying out of him

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: A lifetime ago Frank said our job here was to journey to the furthest corners and grab the music we found there. The journey has been a long one. But I think I'm finally there. A STUNNED look crosses his face.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (To himself) Oh God. This is REALLY GOOD.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon runs excitedly down the hallway.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Frank! INT. THE CORRIDOR OUTSIDE FRANK’S ROOM - MOMENTS LATER

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Knocking on the door) Frank? INT. FRANK’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Jon walks into the bedroom. It’s empty. The sound of running water comes from the en-suite shower room. Jon stops, staring at something: Frank's HEAD sits on a chair beside the bed. Jon hesitates and then picks up the head. He peers inside, fascinated. He crosses to a mirror and stands, the HEAD raised above his own. Slowly he begins to lower the false head down over his own face - then he freezes. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Something has just occurred to him. If the head if out here and Frank is in the bathroom... He puts the head down and creeps towards the open bathroom door... JON’S P.O.V Someone’s in the shower - obscured by the steamed up cubicle door. Jon peers closer, trying to pierce the fog and finally see Frank’s true face. Suddenly the cubicle door opens and Frank steps out - naked... -.except he’s still WEARING HIS HEAD. He has a clear plastic bag over it, with breathing holes. The one on the bed is the spare. Jon is too surprised to hide and the two men stand staring at each other.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Hello.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Beat) Hello. Jon remembers why he’s there.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I’ve written a song.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon is playing his song for Frank and Clara. And it is, indeed, by far the best he’s ever sounded. He finishes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Amazing.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Really?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I think it’s ...Hey! Can I just make a couple of... Frank sits down at the piano.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So you played... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon gives Clara a triumphant glance as Frank starts working on his song. Clara takes a seat on the stool next to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: And then if you just... Clara moves Frank's fingers to a different note.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Because if you played ...What was that note you played down there, Jon?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Yes because if you played an F there it would be shit. Jon looks like he’s been punched in the face. Clara and Frank continue to turn Jon’s song into something TOTALLY DIFFERENT - something much STRANGER and MORE INTERESTING. Frank is just innocently going about what he does. But Clara is fully aware that she’s crushing Jon.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What do you think? Clara looks up and gives Jon a dreadful, slow smile.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Beat) We're ready.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The band have set up. Don is finishing arranging mics around them.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Frank has decided it's finally time to record the album. They're not using any of my composition which I can't help thinking is a bit of a kick in the teeth bearing in mind the fact that I gave them my fucking nest egg. Don walks through to the hall outside and sits at a mixing desk. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Into desk mic) Vetno tapes. Take one. He starts to RECORD. A MONTAGE of moments from the recording. It twists and turns with overwhelming, beautiful oddness. We hear the theremin moment inspired by the IDIOT SHRIEK SHAVING INCIDENT. Jon still looks annoyed by it. We hear the complicated five second sequence they spent weeks practicing over and over.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The band stand around Don's recording equipment, listening to their work.

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: That's it, Frank?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Uhuh. That’s it. We’re done, Don. We're done.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: It took us three hours to record the album. From start to finish. Two years’ work. Three hours. The band stand around, stunned. Frank notices that Don has a strange smile, eyes glistening.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: (Mumbling) It’s just so good. He nods.

dialogues.speaker: DON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon wakes up. He gets up, starts to get dressed. He glances out of the window... stops suddenly, staring at something in the trees. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: JON’S P.O.V - OUT OF WINDOW Frank is HANGING from a tree. He’s perfectly still.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The band are cutting down the body and carefully lowering it to the ground. Baraque carefully removes the plastic head to reveal DON - quite dead. We see the real Frank, wearing his false head, watching from the back of the group. The rest turn to stare at him Baraque passes him the spare head Don had worn. Frank holds it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band have set up by the lake. They’re placing Don’s body onto a crude wooden raft. Frank lights the raft and pushes it out onto the water. The flames begin to spread, an improvised Viking funeral. The band begin to play Puff the Magic Dragon...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Singing) Puff the Magic Dragon, lived by the sea, and frolicked in the Autumn mist in a land called Honalee... Jon and the others watch the boat drift away into the mist on the lake. Jon hears a PING coming from the iPhone in his hand. One new email.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Singing) Little Jackie Paper loved that rascal puff, and brought him strings and sealing wax and other fancy stuff. Jon is torn between wanting to maintain an appropriate air of mourning and wondering who emailed him. His curiosity wins out. He covertly glances at the iPhone. His eyes widen - amazed at what he’s read. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The fire consumes the raft. Frank stops singing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Goodbye Don. You were the best keyboard player we ever had and the best man I ever knew.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Don used to be the band’s keyboard player?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Yes. First it was Don. Then Lucas. Now it’s you. Frank somberly slips the plastic bag with breathing holes over his head and leaps into the lake. He begins to swim towards the boat.

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (In French - subtitled) What are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m getting his ashes.

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (In French, subtitled) Wait until the fire’s died down. Clara notices Jon looking at his phone.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (To Jon) What?

dialogues.speaker: A BAND MEETING
dialogues.text: Frank is shivering with a blanket around him.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: You've been secretly putting clips of us on what?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You Tube. But that’s not the news. I got an email.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: You Tube?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Just snippets. But... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Show me. Jon presses play. 56. CLOSE on the screen: A grainy, tantalizing 20 second video of FRANK singing at Vetno.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I made the clips really short and tantalizing. So you're like a mysterious masked man.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: You spied on us?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: No. Yes. But that’s not the point. The point is I got an email this morning. Because of these clips we've been offered a gig. A really important gig. They stare at him. She heads

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: South By Southwest! In Texas. It’s very prestigious. They’ve got a New Discoveries strand. They want us to launch the album at New Discoveries.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Snorting) How ridiculous. for the door.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on, Frank. Let’s get you into the shower.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Looking at You Tube) Why does it say 23,751 at the bottom?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: That’s the number of people who’ve watched the clip. Frank looks at Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Reload. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon presses reload.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: .-.23,752 people interested in us? (Beat) This is like magic. Clara glares at Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (To Frank) I told you we could be big.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon, NAKED, soaks himself in the bubbles, looking pleased with himself. Clara appears, standing ominously over the Jacuzzi.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Hissing loudly to make herself heard over the bubbles) What game are you playing filling Frank's head with bullshit ideas about festivals in America?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Loudly ) I can’t hear you over the sound of the bubbles. Clara angrily prods the Jacuzzi switch. The bubbles get bubblier.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: How the fuck do the fucking bubbles...?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Loudly ) You just pressed the full bubble strength button. Clara furiously punches the buttons.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Loudly ) They’re on a timer. You just restarted. They won’t switch off for 10 minutes now.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Shouting) Leave Frank alone. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Shouting back) YOU leave Frank alone. That time he thought he’d been kidnapped by you? I’m beginning to suspect it was true! Jon steps out of the Jacuzzi. He’s toe to toe with Clara.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m fully aware you want me to end up like Don or Lucas. But that’s not going to be my role in this band.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Middle Management!

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Josef Fritzl!

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Piers Morgan!

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Cunt! Panting with rage, Clara suddenly notices Jon is naked. Her eyes involuntarily flitter downwards. They look at each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon and Clara are having VIOLENT SEX in the forest. Clara is on top of Jon, grabbing hold of his hair, SMASHING his head onto a rock on the ground. Jon is both desperately aroused and also in a LOT of pain. He pants and grunts and says Ow. For a moment he looks worried that she’s actually trying to murder him.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The sex is over. Jon and Clara lie naked amid the nature, looking up at the sky.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: This is going to be awkward.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: What is?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Us. You know. Together. Clara has a good laugh. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: We'll never be ‘together’.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: I find you disgusting.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Oh. Okay.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Me with you...!

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I get the point. (Beat) Clara. What does he look like?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Shrugging) I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: You've never seen him without the head on? Clara shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Who made it for him?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: He doesn’t talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I thought maybe Don had. In the mental hospital. Jon stares sadly into the sky.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Was it awful in the mental hospital, Clara?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Was it awful in there?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: How do I know? (Beat) What are you talking about? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: No. What?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) I... assumed you're mentally ill.
