dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Stiffly) Well I’m not.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Surprised) Huh! (Beat) So why are you so against us finding an audience? If it’s not because you’re mentally ill?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: When you package the music you kill it.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: But how are people going to hear the album if we don’t launch it? The music doesn’t exist until people hear it. Who are we doing it for otherwise? Clara looks at Jon as if he’s an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: For each other.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Suddenly) You love Frank! You're in love with him! You're scared that if other people love him you’1l lose him

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Fuck off.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Teasingly) You're in love with him! Clara picks up a nearby rock and mimes violently bludgeoning Jon to death. Jon stops teasing Clara. She puts the rock back down. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Sighing) If you fuck everything up in America I'll stab you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band, still long-haired and dirty and bearded, emerge with their luggage from the SILENCE and STILLNESS of Vetno. Everyone looks anxiously at the outside world. They walk towards their van, which has gathered significant dust.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Today we leave Vetno. Hashtag weirdly nervous.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. VAN
dialogues.text: Clara is driving. CARS zoom loudly past them. They involuntarily SHRINK back into their seats like children raised by wolves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band sit in the van, looking deeply self-conscious and alienated. A PETROL PUMP ATTENDANT approaches.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Don’t do anything weird. Clara shoots the attendant a massively over-friendly smile.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Fill her up please! Of course in her desperate effort to seem normal she's coming over as TOTALLY CRAZY. Frank's arm shoots involuntarily upwards, as we...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A breathtaking desert landscape, into which drives a rental van.  62. INT. RENTAL VAN - TEXAS DESERT - DAY. Jon looks out of the window.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Wow. It’s like Paris, Texas. So, okay, I’ve booked us a warm-up show in Houston. Very low key. Just to ease our way back into the world. And then straight to South By Southwest...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Pull over, Jon. Frank roots around in the back of the van.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What are you looking for?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band stand watching as Frank with a bag of Don’s ashes.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don, I remember you saying that the desert here was your favorite place in the whole world. After Sea World, San Diego. And I know you were homesick, Don. I know there were times you wanted to come back here, but you didn’t because of me. Well you’re home now Don. And we’re going to make sure that those sacrifices you made weren’t in vain. It’s your album we recorded Don - and we’re going to share it with the world. He opens the bag and tosses the ashes into the air. There’s no wind and they land with a CLUMP on the sand in front of them.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. DRESSING ROOM
dialogues.text: It’s a down-at heel place in a Houston suburban strip. Baraque, beard gone, head shaved, is busy shaving the rest of the band’s heads. It makes them look even more like a cult. Nana is painting over Frank’s painted hair, so that he too looks shaved.  63.

dialogues.speaker: THE WINGS
dialogues.text: The band watch Frank, waiting for the word from him, like soldiers waiting for their Captain.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: In this moment only the five of us know what the whole world is about to know. That we have found the music that will change everything. The band look determined, almost grim. They march out onto the stage to be met by a faint welcoming applause. They glance at each other, understanding the huge significance of the moment. Nana and Baraque begin to play. After a moment Clara and Jon join in. Frank stands in the wings, listening. And very slowly his head begins to GLOW. As the head reaches MAXIMUM ILLUMINATION he BOUNDS OUT onto the stage, jerking and shuffling to the beat. He sings.

dialogues.speaker: DISSOLVE TO
dialogues.text: A MONTAGE of moments from the live show. It twists and turns with overwhelming, beautiful oddness. Finally the music ends in a gigantic crescendo. We await the inevitable roar from the crowd. But instead... ...the SMALL, BAFFLED AUDIENCE offer a tiny SMATTERING of UNINTERESTED APPLAUSE. The band stare at the crowd. They can’t believe it.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The band sit behind a STALL, failing to sell any copies of the Vetno album. The AUDIENCE - ORDINARY LOOKING MEN and WOMEN - walk past them without showing any interest.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We got the music wrong.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: The music’s right. They’re wrong. Fuck them. Our American adventure is over. We go back to Europe.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: No! Forget these hick conformist fucks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: PASSER-BY
dialogues.text: (Overhearing) Nice.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Sorry. (Beat) South By Southwest booked us because they already know and love us! Frank looks at Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Things will be different at South By Southwest. Trust me, Frank. They love us already there. Frank. They love us already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band, just arrived, make their way through the buzzy festival CROWDS. The atmosphere is much more bohemian and hipsterish than at the warm-up show. A HIPSTER BAND plays on a nearby bandstand. HIPSTERS in nerd glasses hand out fliers for their gigs. Jon is delighted to be among these refreshingly cool, young, free-thinking people. He’s truly in his Xanadu. Passers-by look impressed by the band.

dialogues.speaker: PASSER-BY
dialogues.text: Awesome costumes you guys!

dialogues.speaker: PASSER-BY 2
dialogues.text: You look amazing. Where are you playing?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (To the passer-by) The Blind Pig.

dialogues.speaker: PASSER-BY
dialogues.text: Awesome venue! Good luck! Jon shoots the others a thrilled and vindicated look.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon is at the accreditation desk, behind which stands two beautiful hipster festival official - SIMONE and ALICE. Simone exudes LACONIC HIPSTER IRONY, Alice is more UPBEAT and SINCERE. The rest of the band hang back. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SIMONE
dialogues.text: (Dryly) My spidey-sense tells me... Jon grins, impressed, at the phrase ‘spidey-sense’. SIMONE (CONT’D) .--that you guys are The... Simone attempts their name.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: That’s us!

dialogues.speaker: SIMONE
dialogues.text: And you’re Jon.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: We follow you on Twitter! Awesome job!

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Delighted) Thanks!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: So. Here’s the passes and an information pack. Oh, did Simone pronounce your name right?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Jon?

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: The band’s name.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Oh. I actually don’t know. (Calling, to Clara) Clara? How do we pronounce the band’s name? A little way back, Clara shrugs, unhelpfully.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: You guys are hilarious! So a bunch of us are having dinner tonight at a hot dog place in town. Come!

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Awesome!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a BEAUTIFUL YOUNG WOMAN singing a pretty, childlike song - perhaps PRINCESS CHELSEA singing THE CIGARETTE DUO. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: We pull back. She’s performing on a little stage in the corner. HIPSTER DINERS - including Jon - regard the singer with FONDNESS. Clara regards her with HORROR. The place is ironically tacky and July 4th themed - American flags, Uncle Sam paraphernalia, portraits of Joey ‘Jaws’ Chestnut, the world’s greatest hotdog competitive eater. The band, Simone and Alice eat hot dogs at a big table. Frank holds a napkin over his face to cover the shameful sight of his feeding himself tiny bits of sausage under the neckline of the head.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: (To Frank) You guys have been in the forest so long all this craziness has to be kind of intimidating I guess. Frank continues to completely conceal his ‘face’ with the napkin.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Trying to sound normal ) Oh quite the contrary, I’m delighted to be launching our album here, Delighted look. Clara's eyes dart across the room. Clara's POV: A nightmarish montage of HIPSTER MEN and WOMEN, all looking EERILY SIMILAR - nerd glasses, Zooey Deschanel faces, ironic facial hair, tacky t-shirts that advertise Ocean Spray, etc.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To Alice) I'm excited that for the first time we'll be performing for people who already know and love us, thanks to Jon and his clever secret camera. Frank's voice has taken on a weirdly formal air.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (To Alice and Simone) They didn’t know I was filming them at Vetno.

dialogues.speaker: SIMONE
dialogues.text: (Dryly) / Well, how about you, Mister Secret Squirrel. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I AM Mister Secret Squirrel!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Well it worked. We noticed you. And you got invited here.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Thrilled grin! Frank's arm slips and he spills a jug of syrup over himself and his food.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh dear!

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Oh, man, are you okay? Frank clumsily tries to clean the syrup off himself.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m fine! I’m so fine you shouldn't even bother mentioning the thing that’s currently happening. Frank's attempts at cleaning himself are making him and his head FAR STICKIER.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Really! Carry on talking as if this isn’t happening.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: (Slightly weirded- out) O-kay. So. Who have you played for in the past?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Formally) Until now our audiences have tended to be people who chance upon us and realize after a few minutes that they don’t like us. Clara stops GLARING at hipsters in time to sigh ostentatiously at this.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I see it in their faces, Clara. First they’re like this. But then they’re like this. Frank continues to try and clean himself. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To Alice) So this is a most exciting and unique opportunity you’ve given us. Frank gives Alice a sincere look. By now he has bits of syrupy-napkin stuck all over his face. Jon, seeing Frank's predicament, springs into efficient action. He spits on a napkin and begins wiping the detritus from Frank’s face.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Mummy's here. Baraque sniggers.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Indicating the childlike hipster singer) Why don’t you team up with Princess Marigold over there and start a day care center. She can sing the baby songs and you can wipe the faces and the asses.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Actually, I gotta tell you guys, We know who you are. Simone and me. We found you. But the audience won’t have heard of you yet.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Astonished) But more than 23,700 people watched us on You Tube.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Nervously) They’re cool, though, right? I mean... He surveys the room. Jon’s POV: the same people Clara found so eerie Jon is finding awesome.

dialogues.speaker: SIMONE
dialogues.text: (Dryly) They’11 love you. Jon does a slight double-take. Simone’s vocal tone is consistently so ironic it’s hard to tell if she means anything she says.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE
dialogues.text: Are you crazy? They’ll go crazy for you! You do know that a stand out gig at New Discoveries can... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Alice does an impression of a rocket shooting off into the stratosphere. Jon looks alarmed.

dialogues.speaker: ALICE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: But, hey, don’t sweat it! Just be yourselves! Maybe do some research about which bands did well at New Discoveries and which bands didn’t in previous years and try and work out why and just be yourselves! The singer finishes to APPLAUSE from everyone except Clara, Nana and Baraque.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The place is deserted. Jon sits hunched intensely over his laptop. The rest of the band enter.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: What is it Jon? You look scared. Has something bad happened?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Not scared. I’ve worked something out. Look. They approach Jon’s laptop.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Enthused) Right. Frank. You’re abnormal. Frank nods, equally enthused.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let me show you someone else who’s abnormal. Jon presses play. ON THE SCREEN - A You Tube clip of BABY DEE singing beautifully but very strangely...

dialogues.speaker: BABY DEE
dialogues.text: (Singing) Who can save me from the man Who wields the grinding stone He wields the grinding stone.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Abnormal. Did a New Discoveries. 16 You Tube hits. The song ends. We hear a smattering of applause from the tiny audience. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Whereas... Jon presses play.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE SCREEN
dialogues.text: A more MAINSTREAM band - still difficult and avant-garde, but with a generally more likeable, nerdy, ironic, SELF- AWARE demeanor, and a nice stable drum beat.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Still abnormal. Stormed New Discoveries. 380,000 You Tube hits. What does this teach us?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Beat) Go on.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: That two years in the forest has calibrated us slightly too far towards the wrong sort of mental. Everything that’s successful here happens within a certain boundary that we are currently just outside of.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Nobody's listening to you. Mediocre Child.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (At Clara) Shh. Clara looks like she’s been slapped.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: We've always demanded that the audience stretch their corners all the way out to meet ours, Frank, but what if we pull our corners in a tiny bit - just a tiny, tiny bit - so everyone’s corners can meet in a place that's stilla really long way off but a bit less... Jon does a exaggerated impression of Clara’s Idiot Shriek Theremin solo.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: ..-and a bit more... likeable. Do we want a smattering of baffled applause at New Discoveries or do we want to raise the fucking roof? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: ON THE SCREEN - the more likeable band finish their song to RAPTUROUS APPLAUSE.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Frank? Frank holds his hand out to hush Jon. A silence. Frank is silently composing.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (with great import) I think I’m writing my most likeable song ever.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Can we hear it? Clara looks like she wants to kill Jon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits at the keyboard. The rest of the band gather in readiness to hear Frank’s most likeable song ever. Jon films the scene on his iPhone.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’ve always dreamed that one day I’d have a band member who shared my vision of creating extremely likeable music. So thank you, Jon. You gave me the little push I needed. Okay. Enough chatter. Here it is. My most likeable song ever. Frank begins to play. Bang! Bang! Bang! It's the same glorious, strange, ridiculous, totally non-mainstream stuff that Frank has always played. The madder end, in fact, of his oeuvre. Frank finishes. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: This is your most likeable song?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Yes. Clara doesn’t show a thing on her face.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: People will love it. Frank raises his arms in jubilation. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Clearing his throat) Actually, Frank, I think we can push the likability even further.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No way! You’re shitting me. (Beat)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The band has gathered with their instruments. Jon has got hold of some VIDEO EQUIPMENT. He’s standing behind the camera.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (To Jon) Let me see if I got this right. You want us to make a video in which we pretend our music doesn’t matter so the people here who act like babies won’t be scared of us.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: No. Well, sort of. Look. You know the crazy person on the bus that nobody wants to sit next to? That’s us. But if we just lighten up... be a tiny bit more likeably self-aware...

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: I’m not playing a fucking ukulele, I’1l tell you that now.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: I’m going to point at my head a lot! Like this! Frank dances around a little too over-zealously, pointing at his head.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (As he dances) Press record, Jon. I’m ready. Jon presses record on his video camera and hurries over to take his place behind the keyboard. They start playing a MORE HIPSTER version of one of their songs. Everything is a little different. Frank’s voice and dance seem more IRONIC. Jon has a new, ironic, keyboard sound. And hipster sunglasses. Baraque and Nana are dutifully going along with it - their bass and percussion are more unvarying than normal. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Only Clara is holding out. She has adopted her most intimidating scowl, and is playing as HARSHLY as she can muster. But her protest is useless. Jon has managed to make them sound likeable rather than alarmingly experimental. The overall effect - seeing the band like this - is both likeable but also strangely sad. The song reaches an instrumental section. Frank addresses the camera.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Talking too fast) Hi, South By Southwest. We’re the Sknprfbs or something.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: CLOSE on a computer screen. The Forest Video has been uploaded to the NEW DISCOVERIES website.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We've been in the forest for two years like secret squirrels but on Friday night we emerge so come and see us then at the Blind Pig you guys and watch us shake the leaves from our clothes and be not like secret squirrels any more but regular squirrels. We pull out to see that we are in... INT. SIMONE AND ALICE’S OFFICE - DAY Simone and Alice watch the video. Alice regards it with an upbeat and enthusiastic smile, Simone seems more laconic.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. CANOPY. SOUTH BY SOUTHWEST
dialogues.text: A New Discoveries PARTY is in full swing. The CROWD and the decor are cool and ironic and hipsterish.

dialogues.speaker: SIMONE
dialogues.text: (Dryly, to Jon) Love the promo video. Jon looks at her quizzically. Is she being ironic or sincere?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Thanks? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: SIMONE
dialogues.text: I’m being sincere.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Phew! Across the party, Frank is being chatted up by a HIPSTER GIRL.

dialogues.speaker: HIPSTER GIRL
dialogues.text: Awesome promo video.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Talking too fast) Thank you we’re going for a kind of not believing in anything thing awesomely. Clara gets in really close and gives the girl her best DEATH STARE.

dialogues.speaker: HIPSTER GIRL
dialogues.text: (Dryly, to Clara) Oh. Hi. A chilling silence from Clara.

dialogues.speaker: HIPSTER GIRL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know you. You’re the woman from the band who looks like she’s from a different band. Jon, joining them, smirks. He’s filming the party on his iPhone.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (To Frank) Come on, Frank. Let’s get away from these children.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Talking too fast) Leave? Good heavens, no. I’m incredibly happy to be here and relaxed.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The party continues in full-flow. Clara is confronting Jon in a corner.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Frank’s tipping over the edge.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: No he’s not. What are you talking about? He says he’s incredibly happy to be here and relaxed. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: He said it in an unhinged tone of voice and you know it. They look over at Frank, who continues to flirt with the girl.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: He looks pretty happy to me. Whereas you seem...

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Coldly) Out of control. Clara falters, suddenly seeming less confident. She just looks at Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Gosh. You've run out of insults?

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: The party is getting more riotous. Jon wanders anxiously through the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Calling) Frank? (Beat) Frank? He finds Nana and Baraque.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (To Nana) Have you seen... He realizes this is pointless. He turns to Baraque.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have you seen Frank?

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (In French, subtitled) Clara has taken him away.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Where? To the hotel? Baraque gives Jon a cold smile and says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Startled) Where?  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon runs through the streets.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Calling) Frank! Frank! (To a hipster passer- by) Have you seen a man wearing a fake head?

dialogues.speaker: HIPSTER PASSER-BY
dialogues.text: (Laconically) A crazy-looking lady is pulling a guy with a fake head along just around that corner. Could that be the guy in the fake head you’re looking for?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Likely. Jon runs around the corner and sees... ..Clara PULLING Frank away, her hand firmly clasped to his.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Yelling) Stop. Clara and Frank stop.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where do you think you’re taking him?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Fuck off, Jon. He’s falling apart.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (To Frank) She’s the one who’s nuts, Frank. Not you. You’re fine! Frank breaks free of Clara. He walks towards Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You know it. You told me yourself that Clara is crazy. She kidnaps you and she’s very weird and doesn’t want you to have fans.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Remember what things were like at Vetno, Frank. There was no stress. Everything was good there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: At this, Frank suddenly stops, midway between Jon and Clara. He glances from one to the other, not knowing which one to go to.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Everything was quiet and good at Vetno, Frank. Don’t you remember? Let’s go back there.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: See! She wants to keep you locked up like at Vetno. She’s just weird and jealous.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: You’re out of your depth, Jon. Frank. You’re not well. We need to be somewhere quiet. Just us.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Tomorrow night is everything we've worked for! They’re ready to love us, Frank. Frank. They’re ready to love us. Don’t throw it away. Frank looks at Clara.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Clara. He starts walking towards Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Oh thank God. Jon watches Frank walk towards him in the moonlight. It’s a beautiful sight. Jon gets out his iPhone and begins to film it.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Calling) You win. Well done. Clara starts walking towards Jon too. Jon continues to film the scene.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (A little tauntingly) I’m sorry Clara. I hope you’re not too sad. Are you a little sad?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Yes I’m a little bit sad. Clara is almost upon Jon now. Jon suddenly realizes Clara’s holding a KNIFE. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Panicking) Chinchilla! Clara STABS JON IN THE LEG.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon falls to the floor and rolls about shrieking.

dialogues.speaker: PASSER-BY
dialogues.text: Jesus Christ. JON'S P.O.V - from the floor. Clara turns to Frank. Is she going to stab him too? But she suddenly realizes what she’s done. The knife falls to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Frank. A PASSER-BY grabs her. ON JON - lying on the floor, beneath the pain, a gleam of remorselessness in his eye. His dream has come true. INT. JON’S HOTEL ROOM - SOUTH BY SOUTHWEST - MORNING Jon is lying on the bed, his leg bandaged, typing into TWITTER on his laptop.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Clara Fricke, our very own Syd Barratt, was arrested today and charged with assault after stabbing me in the leg. See link. We will all miss Clara and sincerely hope that our own crazy diamond will also shine on. Jon smiles slightly to himself.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: And... twitvid. Jon lies back on his bed, satisfied. INT. FRANK’S HOTEL BEDROOM - AFTERNOON Jon hobbles quietly into the room and joins Baraque and Nana staring at a prone Frank lying on his bed.

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: Il Dort. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: He's dead?

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: Asleep. WOMAN’S VOICE (0.S.) He's sick. Jon and Baraque both turn, surprised. It is NANA. And this is the FIRST TIME SHE’S SAID A WORD during the entire movie.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Thrown) He's... just had a fright. He’ll be fine for tonight.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: Not Frank. You.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Sorry?

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: I’ve known it since the first time I saw you. On that beach. You'd have DROWNED Lucas to take his place in the band.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) No I wouldn’t have.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: Because you look inside of yourself and you can’t find anything there.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Yes I can.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: So your only hope is to live off Frank’s talent like a tick. Which is why you had to get rid of Clara. You had to make her stab you.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Clara CHOSE to stab me! Nana sits beside Frank on the bed, takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: (Gently) Frank? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: No answer.

dialogues.speaker: NANA, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: F ade so gently) ‘rank!

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Beat) What?

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: We can’t play without Clara.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What? What are you talking about? She's going to prison! We don’t know how long for! Meanwhile we have the biggest gig of our lives coming up in three hours.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: (Ignoring him) Frank?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Bulldozing) Which, by the way, is getting bigger by the minute. The stabbing could not have come at a better time, Frank. He takes out his phone.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I posted the stabbing clip two hours ago. (Beat) We are currently Twitter's worldwide number one trending topic. I’ve had everyone at South By Southwest on the phone. He plays the clip on his phone - we hear the tinny scene playing out.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: (To Frank) Baraque and I have packed our bags. We’re leaving.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What? No. You... you can’t. From the phone we hear a tinny Jon.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (Over phone) Chinchilla! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You can’t leave! We’ve had 467,328 views. Jon presses reload.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Reload. 467,914 views! They’re all watching! (To Nana and Baraque) Don’t leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nana and Baraque shoot Jon a triumphant look as they head towards the hotel exit.

dialogues.speaker: NANA
dialogues.text: (Over her shoulder) Good luck playing tonight with no band members.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (With bravado) I don’t need luck and I’11 tell you why! One word! ...Unplugged! Nana and Baraque hesitate for a moment. Has Jon pulled an ace card? A little less sure of themselves, they leave. INT. FRANK’S HOTEL BEDROOM - MINUTES LATER Frank is sitting up in bed now. Jon is hobbling animatedly around the room.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Unplugged! Me on acoustic guitar. You on vocals. Delegates really like it when bands go unplugged. It’s a special thing. It’s kind of pure. Jon sounds like he’s trying to convince himself as much as Frank.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: “Delegates”! “Unplugged”. It’s like you speak an amazing foreign language! There’s an edge to Frank’s voice which could be excitement. Or could be panic.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I’m fluent in it. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Frank stares at the empty room behind Jon. Jon notices Frank's tapping hand.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Frank? Are you okay?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Just excited. Just... so... excited!

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Jon and Frank are in the midst of a REHEARSAL in the bedroom - just Frank’s vocals and Jon's guitar.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Hello Twitter. Well I have to say it's extremely nice to have Frank to myself without the others constantly going “Blah blah blah Jon you're a twat" and stabbing me. They’re playing the Vetno music, but the difficult experimental sounds have been replaced by Jon's unexpectedly LIKEABLE INDIE GUITAR SOUND.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: This is actually REALLY GOOD! And he’s right. It’s LIKEABLE. And also quite ORDINARY.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We're igniting the light and letting it shine! Frank wanders into the bathroom as Jon continues to play.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Just doing my ablutions!

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Be as quick as you can! Jon continues to strum.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Jon stands at the bathroom door, still strumming.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Beat) Frank? Frank walks back into the room. He has taken a cosmetic kit to his head. He’s given himself VERY ROSY CHEEKS, a GARISHLY HUGE SMILE, bright BLUE EYE SHADOW... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: We can cure CANCER! Jon stares at Frank uncertainly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon is holding Frank's hand, leading him towards the venue. Frank shakes off Jon’s grip and veers off to the edge of the fun, where HIPSTER SECURITY GUARDS are keeping the fun penned in with concealed BARRIERS. Frank tries to climb over a barrier.

dialogues.speaker: HIPSTER SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: (A big fun smile) Hey man, where are you going?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: To let off fireworks at a cancer hospital.

dialogues.speaker: HIPSTER SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: You’re funny. The Security Guard turns Frank around so he faces the crowd again.

dialogues.speaker: HIPSTER SECURITY GUARD
dialogues.text: (CONT'D)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey, have a great South By. He gently pushes Frank back into the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Don’t touch me! (Glancing at something O.S.) Ohmygod! A store that sells medals and feathers!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s busy, with HIPSTER SHOPPERS. Frank is frantically pinning medals and feathers to his outfit.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (To the owner) It’s okay. We’ve got money.

dialogues.speaker: STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: You’re the guys from the Internet.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Yep. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: I tried to get tickets to see you play tonight, but it’s totally sold out. You’re the hot ticket. What happened to the woman who stabbed the guy?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) She’s in jail.

dialogues.speaker: STORE OWNER
dialogues.text: Oh really?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Believe me it’s no loss.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Shouting across the room) What does a man have to do to get some sex around here? I have

dialogues.speaker: NEVER HAD SEX
dialogues.text: Everyone looks at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. MUSIC VENUE
dialogues.text: A VERY BUZZY atmosphere. A LONG QUEUE to enter - 100 cool people in a really cool venue. These are the movers and shakers. The stage lights come on. The audience hush in excited anticipation. Many in the crowd have their SMARTPHONE VIDEOS ready in anticipation. His guitar around his neck, Jon limps onto the stage, to cheers.

dialogues.speaker: HECKLERS
dialogues.text: Chinchilla! There’s laughter. Jon gamely points at his bandage and gives the crowd a thumbs up. Jon begins to play, his COMPETENT INDIE SOUND. After a moment Frank walks onto the stage, to a big cheer. He walks to the microphone. He stands there, looking at the EXPECTANT AUDIENCE, at bloggers filming him on their iPhones. Frank starts to sing. But words don’t come out. Instead it’s the same weird, high pitched shriek we heard at Vetno. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon continues gamely on, although a look of MASSIVE PANIC crosses his face. The audience glance at each other to say, “Is this cool? How are we supposed to react?” Frank starts to shake uncontrollably. He falls backwards, hitting his head on the speaker. He reaches up to his head and feels a CRACK. He follows it with his finger as it gets wider, wide enough to stick his finger in. Jon stares at the stunned audience, then down at Frank. He’s urgently trying to say something to Jon. But the words won't come out. He indicates that Jon gets closer. Jon does. He puts his ear right to Frank’s ‘mouth’.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Urgently) What, Frank? What is it?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: This music is shit. We PULL BACK to see the full catastrophe on stage, Frank lying, a mess, on the floor, Jon on his knees at his side, the audience standing there, stunned, many of them filming the calamity on their iPhones.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. HOTEL ROOM
dialogues.text: Jon and Frank are slumped in their room. Jon looks utterly defeated.

dialogues.speaker: PRESENTER
dialogues.text: ..-Cleveland, Ohio band Mister Gnome had all of Austin talking last night with a barnstorming set at South by Southwest...

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Aren't we supposed to be playing at South by Southwest? Jon lets out a big sigh. He looks at his iPhone. CLOSE on Jon’s iPhone - 13 new emails. We catch a glimpse of a few words: ‘You guys are insane!’ ‘From Sony Music’. ‘If you can somehow pull it together...’ (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Glimpsing hope) Frank. I know you weren't happy with the music. So let's work on it together. Frank shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: You're not Clara.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. CAR
dialogues.text: Jon is driving towards the city limits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The DESERT looms just beyond a cluster of scrappy, working-class trailer homes. Jon pulls up outside one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He knocks on the door. A PERUVIAN SHAMAN answers.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Hello. I saw your advert. In High Times? The Shaman considers this.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: Do you have $40? Jon hands the Shaman the money. He beckons Jon inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Shaman leads Jon through the living room - where his WIFE is watching Daytime TV - and into his kitchenette, where an enormous ORNATE SHAMANIC BLOWPIPE sits on the table. He begins to prepare the AYAHUASCA POWDER. He starts to CHANT: ‘O-day-o-day-o-day...’

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: (Between chants) Ayahuasca. The doorway to the other realms. I evoke the spirit of the plant. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He continues chanting. The TV is blaring 0.S. The Shaman flinches, irritated, and chants louder to try and drown it out.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Finally, yelling to his wife) Will you TURN THAT DOWN! She does.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Between chants) It was my wife’s sister's idea. (Adopting a woman’s voice) “Move to America. You can be the movie stars’ Ayahuasca shaman! You'll live in Beverly Hills!” You know what it turns out movie stars don’t want?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: Ayahuasca. (Beat) Are you of sound mind? The Shaman continues to chant, heating up strange liquid on the hob, chopping plants.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I am.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: You are not depressed? He unexpectedly pours steaming black liquid, filled with pink petals, onto Jon’s head.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I suppose I’ve been miserable lately but I wouldn’t say depressed. (Beat) Why? The Shaman blows weird grey smoke on Jon’s head. It snakes around his face.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: Ayahuasca takes you to the furthest corners of your imagination. You must be strong enough to face what you find there whether it be angel or beast. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: This is exactly what I’ve been wanting to do! I really want to go to my furthest corners.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Gravely) Because I want to unlock the music. The Shaman nods.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Have I taken the Ayahuasca yet?

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Good, because nothing's happened.

dialogues.speaker: SHAMAN
dialogues.text: You will take it. Something will happen. The Shaman lifts the blowpipe. Jon takes one end of it in his mouth. He hesitates, wondering what the hell he’s about to do to himself.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Actually can I just...? The Shaman blows the powder into Jon’s mouth. Jon looks at the Shaman. Then he falls backwards into the sofa. Almost instantly he sits back up again and takes a NOTEBOOK from his pocket.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m going to write music now. Goodbye. He walks PURPOSEFULLY out of the trailer and towards the DESERT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon wanders through the dunes, wildly unhinged but blank faced. WIDE - He has not strayed at all far from the FREEWAY. A steady stream of CARS roar past him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon reaches a CRUMBLING ROADSIDE CAFE and he gratefully sits down at a table outside. He takes out his notebook and stares at its blank white page, waiting for inspiration. The cafe sign above his head CREAKS slightly in the breeze. Jon stares sternly up at the sign.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Be quiet. I’m trying to hear what's inside me. And suddenly ALL SOUND CUTS, and Jon finds himself sitting in an IMPOSSIBLE SILENCE. He looks at the CARS and TRUCKS roaring past. But they too are HORRIBLY SILENT. Jon looks trapped and frightened inside this oppressive silence, like an insect trapped in an airless jar. Jon listens to the infinite silence inside himself. He mouths a subtitled sentence.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Subtitled) I can’t hear anything. (And then, terrified) I can’t hear ANYTHING! He looks down at his body and - like a bubble of nothingness - he POPS. He EVAPORATES. He is GONE.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank and Jon are eating at the tiny table. Jon is unshaven. The place is a mess. A steel, pull-down light hangs over the table. As Frank bends forward to his Complan his head clinks against it. It dings. He leans back. Then he leans forward to the straw again. He clinks his head against the light again. Another ding. Jon watches him in mounting irritation. Frank leans forward again. Jon catches the light and pushes it up before there can be another “ding”.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Hardly caring any more) (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The motel owner says if we don’t pay in full by the end of the week they’re going to throw us out. A FLY buzzes around Frank’s head. Frank tries to swat it, but - being in a fake head - his spatial awareness is shot to hell and he accidently swipes a cup, spilling rancid coffee all over Jon.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Oh Jesus I’m sorry. Frank grabs a dirty cloth from the sink and starts to mop at Jon's coffee sodden trousers. As he does his head comes very near to Jon's face and Jon leans back in disgust. Clearly, Frank is beginning to smell under his head.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Jesus! Jon picks up a VERY LONG STICK with a BABY WIPE attached to the end. He waves it at Frank.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Through gritted teeth) I made it. Now will you use it? Frank inserts the baby wipe inside his head. Trying to clean himself. Jon watches in silence. Suddenly...

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Softly) Take it off. Frank stops moving.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The head. Maybe you should take it off. Frank stares at Jon for a long time. Then he shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Trying to be enthusiastic, but sounding tense and nuts) You know, in Cognitive Behavioral Therapy they say face your fears! They say Take The Head Off! So let’s do it! Let’s take the fucking head off! Jon walks closer to Frank. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Scared) Jon? I don’t think I... Jon reaches Frank and tries to touch the head.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’ve got a certificate.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat, quietly) I know you've got a certificate. (Beat) I KNOW YOU'VE GOT A

dialogues.speaker: FUCKING CERTIFICATE
dialogues.text: Jon and Frank are struggling now, Jon is trying desperately to PULL Frank’s head off. The sudden VIOLENCE inside Jon is shocking.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Take it off! Weird noises begin to emanate from inside Frank’s head. They’re the noises of a terrified animal. The shock of the noises makes Jon hesitate for an instant. As he does, Frank slips from his grasp and runs shrieking towards the door. He manages to get it open and runs out... And Jon, as if waking from a nightmare, realizes what he’s done...

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No! Frank! I’m sorry! I don’t know what I was thinking! Frank!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: --the BRIGHT SUNLIGHT. Shrieking, bewildered, Frank runs confused out of the motel and towards the SIDEWALK. Jon runs a little way after him.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Frank! I’m sorry! Come back!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank runs, disoriented, onto the sidewalk, then over the curb, and out onto the HIGHWAY. He gets smaller and smaller. He keeps going. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: And then he is HIT BY A CAR. The car screeches to a halt as Frank flies over the windshield. Jon starts to run towards the scene of the accident. He reaches the car, and then he walks around it, expecting to see Frank lying there. But Frank isn’t there. Instead there is just his HEAD, lying SHATTERED on the road. The driver is standing there, shocked.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where did he go?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: That way.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Did he look injured?

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: He was limping.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Did you see his face? The driver begins to answer. Jon takes half a step back into the oncoming traffic and is HIT BY A CAR. Cut to BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. HOSPITAL
dialogues.text: Jon lies asleep. He’s on a drip. Bandaged up. He wakes up. Looks around. He can’t remember why he’s there. And then he remembers. He closes his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A heavily bandaged Jon sits waiting in the station. A COP walks over with a form on a clipboard.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: You want to report a missing person? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Ok. What’s the person’s name?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Frank.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Frank what? Jon considers this.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Just... Frank? The Cop examines him balefully.

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: Age?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Uh, somewhere between thirty and... fifty?

dialogues.speaker: COP
dialogues.text: (Beat) What's he look like? Jon considers this. He starts to tear up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon, still bandaged, but on the slow path to recovery, sits at the counter, staring out into the distance. The YOUNG MAN beside him has been watching him for a while. Now he clicks his fingers.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Been driving me crazy, but I know who you are.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Emptily) Oh?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: You're the Chinchilla guy, right? Jon nods sadly. YOUNG MAN (CONT’D) Awesome. Chinchilla guy, and the guy with the big head and the crazy chick... Clara? Right? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon looks at him.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: How do you know her name?

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Are you kidding?. You’re like myths. There’s footage of you fucking everywhere online. Jon laughs sadly. YOUNG MAN (CONT’D) All totally erratic and shit. Nervous breakdowns. “Chinchilla!” People rolling around on the floor. Just wayward! And now it’s all, ‘What’s happened to Frank? He’s just vanished.’ Fucking hilarious. Jon looks at him with dislike.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I don’t think it’s hilarious.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG MAN
dialogues.text: Really? I thought it was supposed to be hilarious. I mean, like that Clara? Being a total freak. Jon stares down at his coffee.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Don’t call her that.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. ROADSIDE BLUES BAR
dialogues.text: A down-at-heel roadside venue. Jon enters to find the place practically deserted - just some TRUCKERS and BIKERS and DRUNK LOCALS. Clara, Nana and Baraque are on stage playing the blues in a perfunctory manner to the small uninterested crowd. Jon stands in the doorway, looking profoundly sad at what he’s reduced them to. Clara and Nana and Baraque notice him. Their blues trail off to silence. A few of the DRUNKS applaud uncertainly.

dialogues.speaker: LATER
dialogues.text: Jon and the band sit at a booth table. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Coldly) We're trying to raise the money to get back to Europe. Jon looks desperately sorry.

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (In French, subtitled) How did you find us? Jon slides a NEWSPAPER across the table. CLOSE on the newspaper. Between gig listings for ‘Bayou Boogie’ and ‘The Chicken on the Bone Party Band’ is one for a residency for ‘The Oeccscclhjhn Blues Trio’.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Everything you said, Nana. It was true. I was a snake. (His voice breaking) You have to let me try and put it right. Clara turns her face away.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Utterly broken) If you don’t let me try, this is what I’1l be until I die.

dialogues.speaker: BARAQUE
dialogues.text: (In French - subtitled) The man who killed the music.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I love all of you. And I’m so sorry. A silence.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Where’s Frank?

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) He ran away.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Softly) Then I will help you find him. Jon looks at Clara with huge sadness and gratitude.  96.

dialogues.speaker: I/E. CAR
dialogues.text: Jon gives Clara a sad, world-weary smile. Two travellers who have been through a great and terrible adventure together.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: I turned us all into freaks for people to laugh at on the internet. Clara pulls a cigarette out of her packet and pushes in the car’s cigarette lighter.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: So I was thinking that the way to find Frank might be... Clara unexpectedly leans over and begins VIOLENTLY STRANGLING JON.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Yelping) Clara? Clara grabs the back of Jon’s head and starts to slam it repeatedly into the steering wheel.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That really fucking hurts! Clara! Clara grabs the red-hot cigarette lighter and presses it against Jon's skin. It sizzles.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: FUCK! FUCK! Clara! The car swerves off the road, into a field, and crashes into a tree. Their heads slam against the windscreen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clara and Jon stand by the wreckage of Jon's car.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What the fuck did you do that for? You could have killed BOTH

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: (Yelling - the old Clara) I leave you alone with him for

dialogues.speaker: FIVE MINUTES
dialogues.text: Clara begins to calm down. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Are we okay now? You’ve got your revenge?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: We're okay now.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: It’s finished?

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: It’s finished now. I’ve got it out of my system.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon and Clara are limping through the nothingness, back towards the roadside bar. A TRUCK approaches. Jon sticks his thumb out, giving the truck driver a plaintive smile. Clara gives Jon a MASSIVE SHOVE, trying to push him into the truck’s path. The truck narrowly misses Jon, its horn blaring.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Jesus FUCKING CHRIST, Clara! Will you fucking FUCKING STOP? (Astonished) You're actually trying to kill me! Clara gives Jon the finger.

dialogues.speaker: CLARA
dialogues.text: Fuck you and fuck Frank. She quickly walks away - back in the direction of the Roadhouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon sits at a table, looking wretched, surfing the net. CLOSE on Jon’s web search. Page after page is dedicated to videos and photos of the band: the Chinchilla stabbing, the Vetno rehearsals, Frank's nervous breakdown on stage at South By Southwest. And then more pages - fans speculating on Frank’s disappearance and possible whereabouts. There are sightings in Fairbanks, Alaska, Pahrump Nevada; Quatchita, Louisiana... (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon stops suddenly and STARES at the words - Quatchita, Louisiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A FLASHBACK to...

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: He told me once he came from Louisiana. That’s all I know.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Louisiana?

dialogues.speaker: DON
dialogues.text: Quatchita, Louisiana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GRIM LANDSCAPE of RURAL POVERTY, strewn with old rusting metal, abandoned vehicles, shacks, hungry-looking dogs. HILLBILLY CHILDREN and OLD PEOPLE stare suspiciously at JON as he pulls up outside a SHACK in his HIRE CAR.

dialogues.speaker: GPS VOICE, (0.S)
dialogues.text: You have reached your destination.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (To himself) Christ. It’s like Winter’s Bone. CLOSE on the details of the POVERTY and SUSPICION. Jon gets out Twitter.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (With great solemnity, as he types) I've found Frank's childhood home. It's so bleak. No wonder he never talked about it. I wouldn't be surprised if he was the victim of some kind of... Jon sighs.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: .-farm abuse. And now I get it. This is the pain you need to make the great music. Hashtag but is it worth it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon nervously leaves the car, approaches a HILLBILLY MAN. Other HILLBILLIES stand a little way off, watching.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (His voice quivering) I’ve come to see Frank. The man stares silently.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (Beat) Wears a fake head? The hillbilly spits on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: HILLBILLY
dialogues.text: Ain’t no one round here wears a fake head.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Okay. (Plucking up courage) Except He grew up here. And he’s been sighted here. So I think he actually may be here? The hillbillies share a HARD-TO-DECIPHER LOOK.

dialogues.speaker: HILLBILLY
dialogues.text: He’s in the shed. The hillbilly indicates a nearby CREEPY WOODSHED.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Frank’s in that shed?

dialogues.speaker: HILLBILLY
dialogues.text: I’1l show you. The hillbilly walks towards the shed. His friends follow. HILLBILLY (CONT’D) C'mon. Jon nervously begins to follow.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Actually, you know what, I think I'll leave it.

dialogues.speaker: HILLBILLY
dialogues.text: He’s in there. I’1l show you. (Calling towards the shed) Frank. You got a visitor. (CONTINUED)
The hillbillies, with a now terrified Jon in tow, ENTER the shed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lying on the floor, in the straw, is an OLD SCARECROW with a grotesque FAKE HEAD. The HILLBILLIES laugh.

dialogues.speaker: HILLBILLY
dialogues.text: Is this your friend? Jon politely laughs. HILLBILLY (CONT’D) I told you ain’t no one round here wears a fake head.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Right!

dialogues.speaker: HILLBILLY
dialogues.text: What’s the address you’re looking for? Jon gets out his MAP QUEST print-out. The HILLBILLIES ponder it. The Head Hillbilly spits on the floor again. HILLBILLY (CONT’D) You typed the wrong zip code into your GPS.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Did I?

dialogues.speaker: HILLBILLY
dialogues.text: (Pointing at the print-out) Says here 71008. You typed 71007.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Oh, gosh.

dialogues.speaker: HILLYBILLY
dialogues.text: Place you're looking for'’s about nine miles that way.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Beat) Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The contrast couldn’t be starker. This is as MIDDLE CLASS SUBURBAN as it gets. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon sits in his hire car at the bottom of a driveway. He looks disappointed.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (To himself) It’s like where I bloody grew up. He takes a breath. He climbs out of his car. In the front garden ...a FIGURE, his back to Jon. Jon walks towards the figure. He stops suddenly, afraid. Then he takes a few steps forward. The man turns around. He has the most incredible, expressive face. It is obviously Frank.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Oh, Frank. I’m so ashamed. I should never have tried to pull your head off.

dialogues.speaker: MAN WITH AMAZING FACE
dialogues.text: (In a voice sounding nothing like Frank's) I’m the tree surgeon. I’m just here to look at the tree.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hi Jon. Jon turns around. Across the garden is Frank. Without his head. Looking nice, gentle, and really quite normal. He’s standing with two elderly people - Frank’s PARENTS. All three are wearing gardening gloves. Mary holds a running hose. They stare at Jon with puzzled smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jon sits with Frank, his Mother and Father. They drink coffee but Jon doesn’t touch his.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: It used to be a miracle to see him downstairs like this, right Frankie?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: (Smiling) That’s right.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: When Frank was a boy we couldn’t get him out of his bedroom. (MORE ) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FATHER, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I mean, he'd get hysterical if we tried to move him.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: What happened to you, Frank? Something must have happened to make you like that. Father looks at Jon like he’s an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: Nothing happened to him. He’s mentally ill. Jon glances over at the mantelpiece. There’s a FAMILY PHOTOGRAPH from Frank's childhood. CLOSE on the photograph: Frank’s PARENTS and TEENAGE FRANK, trying to hide his face with his hand.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: When he was about seventeen he stopped talking altogether. They called it Selective Mutism. He selected it to be all the time. We didn’t know what to do. So... that was when he went into the hospital. Broke my heart.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: (Hopefully) And that’s when you started making music? As a kind of expression of the madness?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No. I was always musical. Far back as I can remember. If anything the madness slowed me down. Frank frowns at his memories. Then he points at his face.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Look! Facial expressions! Oh, you were right about encouraging me to take the head off. Now I’ve got used to it it’s fine. I think I'd been using it as a bit of a crutch.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: The head was my fault. I made him his first one. He was 14. He just begged me and begged me. He said it was for a costume party. (Getting upset) I did it. Even though I knew there wasn’t any costume party. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A silence. 103. (2)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FATHER (CONT’D) Turns out the worst thing to do with an anxiety disorder is pander to it.

dialogues.speaker: MOTHER
dialogues.text: Who knew?

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: He never took it off again.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: Do you want to see my bedroom? INT. FRANK’S BEDROOM - DAY Jon and Frank stand in a little boy’s bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: This is where I wrote my first music.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Have you written anything since you’ve been back?

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No. I tried, but nothing good came out. It sounded, no offence, Jon, like the kind of stuff you’d write. Jon smiles sadly. Jon nods, bed.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I know what you were getting at downstairs. You were hoping that some ...thing had unlocked the music in me. Something you never had. But some people have got it and some people haven't. That’s the truth of it. I mean, I’m terrible at everything else. There’s probably something else you're great at! (Brightly) Like band management! No. Not band Management. Marketing! sadly accepting of his fate. Frank sits on the FRANK (CONT’D) But I’m not good at music any more either. It’s slipped away. I guess because Clara’s gone. So. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: It’s my fault.

dialogues.speaker: FRANK
dialogues.text: No it isn’t. You’ve basically been really helpful. Jon sits on the bed next to Frank.

dialogues.speaker: JON
dialogues.text: Frank. I need to explain to you how I ruined everything. We drift away from them, out of the window, into the garden, where Frank’s mother and father are doing some gardening.

dialogues.speaker: JON, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I think it started right back on that beach in England...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the same down-at-heel bar we met Clara and Nana and Baraque at. They’re still there - playing the blues to LOCAL DRUNKS who don’t care. Jon and Frank enter. They stand hesitantly at the back. Jon gives Frank a small push. He hangs back as Frank walks towards the stage. Clara notices this stranger approaching them. There seems something familiar about him. He climbs onto the stage and approaches the microphone. And he starts to SING. And then she realizes. A look passes between Clara and Frank. And, slowly, as Frank sings, we BEGIN TO PULL BACK. Clara plays more intensely. As do Frank and the others. And the music makes sense again. It swells to something beautiful ...difficult but beautiful. As the music builds into joyful life, we PULL FURTHER BACK, over the AUDIENCE, who don’t seem realize that something incredible is happening. They look uninterested. But then one or two drunks appear to notice that the music has changed into something else. They GLANCE UP from their drinks. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Jon listens from the back. He watches for a moment. Then he slips out of the door. And we... FADE TO BLACK.
